name: QtScrcpy
readme_summary: QtScrcpy is a lightweight, high-performance application for displaying and controlling Android devices on your computer via USB or network. It requires no root access and supports Windows, macOS, and Linux, offering low latency and fast startup times.
key_features: Keyboard and mouse mapping for games/apps
primary_use_case: Mirroring and controlling an Android device's screen on a desktop computer for enhanced productivity, gaming, or development.
cover_image_prompt: A split image: on one side, a person is holding a small, glowing Android phone, looking slightly frustrated. On the other side, a large, clear monitor displays the phone's screen, perfectly mirrored and controllable with a keyboard and mouse. A subtle digital stream connects the phone to the monitor, representing the data transfer. The monitor shows a game being played smoothly, with keyboard keys subtly integrated into the scene. The repository name 'QtScrcpy' is subtly etched on the monitor's frame. The overall style is a clean, modern 3D isometric illustration with a focus on clarity and ease of use, using a cool blue and green color palette.

name: weathr
description: a terminal weather app with ascii animation
readme_summary: Weathr is a command-line interface (CLI) application written in Rust that displays real-time weather information directly in the terminal. It features animated ASCII art for various weather conditions, auto-location detection, and customizable display options.
key_features: Animated ASCII art for weather conditions (rain, snow, thunderstorms, etc.)
Customizable configuration for units, HUD visibility, and location display
CLI options for simulation and unit overrides
Respects environment variables for color and terminal support
primary_use_case: To provide users with a visually engaging and informative real-time weather forecast directly within their terminal environment.
cover_image_prompt: A cozy, dimly lit room with a large, old-fashioned CRT monitor displaying a vibrant, animated ASCII art scene of a thunderstorm. Raindrops are visibly falling on the screen, and lightning flashes illuminate the room. A small, stylized compass icon hovers near the monitor, indicating the auto-location feature. Subtle digital particles flow from the monitor, suggesting data transfer. The overall mood is one of comfort and technological wonder, blending retro aesthetics with modern weather data visualization. The repository name 'weathr' is subtly etched into the monitor's frame. 3D isometric illustration style with a focus on atmospheric lighting and detailed textures.

name: browserless
description: Deploy headless browsers in Docker. Run on our cloud or bring your own. Free for non-commercial uses.
readme_summary: Browserless is a Dockerized headless browser solution that allows users to deploy and manage Chrome, Firefox, or Webkit instances for automated tasks. It supports integration with Puppeteer and Playwright, offering features like parallelism, a debug viewer, and configurable timeouts, and can be run locally or used via their cloud service.
key_features: Debug Viewer for real-time session inspection
primary_use_case: Running automated browser tasks like web scraping, testing, and PDF generation in a scalable and manageable environment.
cover_image_prompt: A whimsical, anthropomorphic browser character acting as a highly efficient factory foreman. The foreman is directing a stream of raw data (represented by glowing digital streams) into various automated machines. Each machine clearly represents a different browser engine (Chrome, Firefox, Webkit) and is outputting perfectly formed documents, screenshots, or reports. The foreman is holding a tablet displaying simple code snippets and queue management interfaces. The background is a clean, organized digital workshop with subtle 'browserless.io' branding on the machinery. The overall mood is one of controlled automation and productivity. Style: 3D isometric illustration with a bright, clean color palette and clear visual indicators.

name: SpotiFLAC
description: Get Spotify tracks in true FLAC from Tidal, Qobuz & Amazon Music â€” no account required.
readme_summary: SpotiFLAC is a desktop application that allows users to download Spotify tracks in high-quality FLAC format. It sources audio from alternative streaming services like Tidal, Qobuz, and Amazon Music without requiring any user accounts or authentication with Spotify.
key_features: Source audio from Tidal, Qobuz, Amazon Music
primary_use_case: Downloading Spotify music in high-fidelity FLAC format without needing a Spotify account.
cover_image_prompt: A digital alchemist in a dimly lit, futuristic workshop, holding a glowing Spotify logo in one hand and a pristine FLAC audio file symbol in the other. The alchemist is pouring streams of high-fidelity audio waves from various high-quality sources (represented by subtle icons of Tidal, Qobuz, and Amazon Music) into a magical crucible. The crucible transforms these streams into perfect, crystalline FLAC files, which then float upwards towards a stylized, minimalist representation of a user's music library. The overall mood is one of sophisticated transformation and quality enhancement, with subtle UI elements and data streams hinting at the underlying technology. 3D isometric illustration style, clean lines, vibrant blues and purples.

name: compressO
description: Convert any video into a tiny size.
readme_summary: CompressO is a cross-platform desktop application built with Tauri and Rust that allows users to significantly reduce video file sizes. It leverages FFmpeg for powerful video compression and offers a user-friendly interface for offline video conversion.
primary_use_case: Reducing video file sizes for easier storage, sharing, and faster uploads.
cover_image_prompt: A whimsical, friendly robot character holding a large, bulky video file (represented as a heavy, old-fashioned suitcase) in one hand, and a tiny, feather-light digital icon of a video in the other. The robot is actively shrinking the suitcase with a magical, glowing compression ray emanating from its chest, transforming it into the small video icon. Subtle digital particles and data streams flow from the suitcase to the icon. The background is a clean, minimalist workspace with a small, unobtrusive UI element showing the CompressO logo and a progress bar. The overall mood is efficient and user-friendly. Style: 3D isometric illustration with bright, clean colors and soft lighting.
